page.title: 02Ref. 04520453: Landscape
page.content: This block is mainly occupied by arable farming. Since the survey was carried out in November, much of the land was lying ploughed and bare. What crops were sown consisted of sugar beet, presumably destined for the nearby B.S.C. processing plant, and winter wheat and barley. There are no significant woodlands or other topographical features in the block, except perhaps the distinctive stright rows of poplar trees which act as windbreaks for many of the farms in the district and have given their name to the villages of{Upper}and{Nether {Poppleton.}
